column4: RT @Georgetown How do the languages spoken within a country contribute to the ways in which citizens understand and identify with their nation? It's a question that one Georgetown student, Andy (G'22) is looking to understand: https://t.co/MXMNN8UL9K

column4: RT @Georgetown As the first female president of any African country, @MaEllenSirleaf took office as Liberia emerged from decades of conflict, and ultimately led her country to sustained peace. She tells her story on the latest episode of #SeekingPeace by @giwps: https://t.co/JjpPFHfDsc https://t.co/dB5QNcKBPd

column4: RT @Georgetown Good luck to @GUAlumni RaMell Ross (C'05), whose latest film, "Hale County This Morning, This Evening" will be up for an Oscar for Best Documentary (Feature.) The film explores impressions of the Historic South, and thus far has received critical acclaim: https://t.co/4GfcNinDPe https://t.co/97IozJ8po6
